org.beiter.michael.authn.jaas.common

Class UserPrincipal

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.authn.jaas.common.UserPrincipal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Principal

    public class UserPrincipal
extends Object
implements Principal
    This class implements a generic user principal.

    In addition to the name attribute (which uniquely identifies this principal), it has two additional optional attributes: a username and domain that were used during authentication.

    Usually the principal uniquely identifies a specific identity by either the name attribute, or by the combination of <username and domain.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserPrincipal(String name)
      Create a new principal without a username or domain set (only use the principal's name).
      UserPrincipal(String name, String domain, String username)
      Create a new principal with the username and domain that were used for authentication (in addition to the principal's name).

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserPrincipal

        public UserPrincipal(String name)
        Create a new principal without a username or domain set (only use the principal's name).
        Parameters:
        name - The principal's identifier (the "name" in Java Principal terms).

      • UserPrincipal

        public UserPrincipal(String name,
                     String domain,
                     String username)
        Create a new principal with the username and domain that were used for authentication (in addition to the principal's name).
        Parameters:
        name - The principal's identifier (the "name" in Java Principal terms).
        domain - The domain used to authenticate the principal
        username - The username used to authenticate the principal

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public final String getName()
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Principal

      • getDomain

        public final String getDomain()
        Return the principal's domain that was used for authentication.

        This is an optional field, and may return a null value if username and domain were not provided for this principal.

        Returns:
        The principal's domain, or null if the domain has not been set.

      • getUsername

        public final String getUsername()
        Return the principal's username that was used for authentication.

        This is an optional field, and may return a null value if username and domain were not provided for this principal.

        Returns:
        The principal's username, or null if the username has not been set.
